page.title: 06St. Agnes: Communications
page.content: There are three Post Offices, offering a comparatively good postal service, at St. Agnes, Goonbell, and Mithian. The main area of St. Agnes has two deliveries a day, but the outlying areas have only one. Many residents have telephones. There is an automatic exchange in St. Agnes. There is a selection of local newspapers that keep residents up-to-date with events. The tabloid "West Briton Argus" comes out on Mondays and the broadsheet "West Briton Gazette" on Thursdays. "The Western Morning News" is a Plymouth-based daily paper, containing both local and national news, that also covers the area. Free Sheets include "The Truro Packet" and "The Tinners Weekly"; and "The Beacon" - a truly local sheet printed and published in St. Agnes.
